class_notes:
Title: Mental disorders: medical disease or human dysfunction?
Description: This course will combine neuroscience, physiology, medicine, and the book Nine Dimensions of Madness: Redefining Mental Health written by Robert Gallon to describe mental disorders as types of human dysfunction rather than medical diseases.
We will:
- Examine mental disorders that span a spectrum of symptoms and clinical presentation mainly depression, schizophrenia, and anti-social personality disorder  
- Discuss symptoms, factors contributing to disease pathology, current treatment protocols, and societal / cultural factors
- Incorporate documentaries, scientific studies, and fiction and non-fiction short stories.
course_description: Variable topics of special interest in the field of Neuroscience and Behavioral Biology. Any of these NBB 190 courses will satisfy the new General Education freshman seminar requirement but will not count as an NBB elective.
